channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #089
item.description: This weekend Rails Rumble is ending up right now. Results will have to wait one week but I bet there will be interesting projects to check out.
item.content:encoded:
#089 - oct 19th 2014

Edito

This weekend Rails Rumble is ending up right now. Results will have to wait one week but I bet there will be interesting projects to check out.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Fluky
Make you own wheel of fortune and roll it.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Rails beginner cheatsheet
This is not a new site, but it can help onboard new rubyists.
Fast ruby
List of benchmarking examples of ruby code, comparing alternatives.
Mastering Modern Payments
(Book) Complete guide to getting paid with Stripe and Rails.
FormKeep
Form endpoints for designers and developers.
GildeRoom
Hangouts without the hangups (webrtc based).
Sublime Text Power User
(Book) Get intimate with Sublime Text.
Bee Free
Online mail composer for campaigns, by Mailup.
TinyScreen
A color display the size of your thumb.
React Fundamentals
Basic fundamentals of React to get you started.
Learn all the nodes
Screencasts about node.js.
Intro to D3.js
This tutorial provides a quick intro to D3.js (not a deep dive).
Building Web Apps with Go
(Book) Learn how to build and deploy web applications with Go..

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby Raptor
A radically new Ruby web server (to be released next month).
Ruboto 1.2.0
JRuby on Android, new version.
Nightmare
A high level wrapper for Phantomjs.
Stack.gl
Open software ecosystem for WebGL, built on top of browserify and npm.
Pageres
Responsive website screenshots from the commandline.
EditorConfig
Helps developers maintain consistent coding styles between different editors.
Fig 1.0
A ton of improvements in this release, including compatibility with boot2docker on OS X.
Dockerize
Utility to simplify running applications in docker containers.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Build your own Google TV Using RaspberryPi, NodeJS and Socket.io oct 13
Full tutorial based on the RaspberryPi-Tv project.
How Does Rails Handle Gems? oct 13
How do Bundler, Rails, and RubyGems work together to make handling dependencies easy.
Leverage Bundler to Get Private Git Repos on Docker Images oct 14
Handle gems based on private repos in docker images.
Polymorphic relations with pg_morph oct 14
Simplify your life with pg_morph.
How Poodle Happened oct 14
Detailled history about this last SSL hole.
CSS-Only Solution For UI Tracking oct 16
CSS-only approach for tracking UI interactions using Google Analytics.
How to Conduct A Content Audit oct 16
For any kind of redesign project you may need to perform a content audit.
8 steps to move Rails view to Marionette oct 16
Use Devise with AngularJS.
How to Set Up Authentication with AngularJS and Ruby on Rails oct 17
Howto with code for moving rails views to backbone and marionette.
Clean Up After Your Capybara oct 17
Avoid the tangled web of test code and markup.
Build a Custom API to Connect WordPress With Ruby on Rails oct 19
The Grape gem for creating an API to expose a part of a Ruby on Rails based shopping cart to outside applications.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
RubyMotion for Rails Developers (16m) oct 13
Create a Hello World application in rubymotion.
AtoZ CSS: TranslateX (5m) oct 16
Performance benefits of using translate over other methods.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant Robots 118 (37m) oct 13
Scare Yourself (Dan Martell).
Ruby5 502 (6m) oct 14
RailsRumble, Ruby Motion for Rails devs, Ruby Hashes, data migrations, clean routes, better logs.
NodeUp 74 (47m) oct 14
A future of npm show.
Arrested DevOps 23 (1h) oct 14
Managing Systems In The Cloud.
Ops All The Things 011 (50m) oct 14
All About Attitude.
The Cloudcast #165 (28m) oct 15
DevOps Automation as a Service.
Ruby5 503 (6m) oct 16
Unary Operators, Writing fast Ruby, each_with_object, ES6 Transpiler, HStore.
Adventure in angular #12 (32m) oct 16
Directives.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 172 (59m) oct 17
heyswell.com and Rails Rumble countdown.
Web Platform #14 (1h08) oct 17
Web Components Interop and Polymer.
The Ship Show 50 (1h04) oct 17
Notes to Your Butler (jenkins).

item.title: Green Ruby News #088
item.description: If you understand japanese, check the presentation of tenderlove at rubykaigi. Damn he's good.
item.content:encoded:
#088 - oct 12th 2014

Edito

If you understand japanese, check the presentation of tenderlove at rubykaigi. Damn he's good.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Designspiration
Resource to help discover and share great design.
The grid
AI websites that design themselves.
Pablo the flamingo
Totally useless dancing flamingo (also check the behind the scene).

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Dev Free Casts
A huge collection of free screencasts for devs.
DevToolsTips
Curated collection of Chrome Developer Tools tips and tricks.
Rails Crash Course
(Book) A No-Nonsense Guide to Rails Development.
Code Fights
Code challenges that test how fast you can debug JavaScript.
Must-Watch CSS
A useful list of must-watch videos about CSS.
Programming course comparison
13 popular options for learning how to code, analyzed and compared.
35 Useful HTML5, JavaScript Tools and jQuery Plugins
Another of those lists, this one has some nice entries.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Quick Secure
Simple script for hardening and securing base linux systems.
Taste Tester
The test-tester utility for testing chef diffs via chef-zero.
PerfMap
Front-end performance heatmap bookmarklet.
kibana-rack
Embed Kibana as a Rack application and creates a proxy to Elasticsearch.
ClassyCancan
Classify your cancancan abilities.
easy-emoji
Make the emoji easier to use for Rails.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Move fast & break nothing oct 3
Transcript of a talk from Zach Holman from Github. Very long and very wise.
Top 8 tools for Ruby on Rails code optimization and cleanup oct 6
Keeping your code clean and organized while developing a large Rails application.
Three Great Ways to Learn Ruby Faster oct 6
In short: Ruby Quiz, Exercism.io and try a tiny app.
Whatâ€™s wrong with Angular.js oct 6
Not everybody is happy about angular. This one explains why, and gets bunch of interesting comments in return.
What I would recommend instead of Angular.js? oct 7
Sequel of the previous one.
The best developer tools, now free for students oct 7
The GitHub Student Developer Pack.
Cleaning up a Rails routes file oct 7
Large Rails apps have a way of gathering cruft. One popular cruft hideout is config/routes.rb.
Introducing Leche oct 7
A JavaScript Testing Utility for Mocha and Sinon.
Object Oriented Programming is an expensive disaster which must end oct 7
A very long writing about OOP. only go there if you have time and brain cells to dedicate to it. Spoiler, functionnal programming is the new black.
Memoization in Ruby, Python and Javascript oct 8
How the different languages haadle memoization.
Analyze ruby execution stack with #caller oct 8
Make backtrace your custom debugging tool with #caller.
Tail Call Optimisation in MRI oct 9
TCO is disabled by default, but it's good to know what it does.
Why Ruby Is the Crown Jewel in a Developer's Resume oct 9
Demand for Ruby on Rails talent continues at a steady pace.
Rebuild a Gem: Rack oct 10
Exercise to rewrite rack for educative purpose.
Refactoring From Model to View Helper to Null Object oct 10
Replacing conditional with polymorphism.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Crash Course on MySQL (23m) oct 8
Common tasks associated with looking after a single MySQL server.
Rules of Devops (35m) oct 8
Talk given at DeveopDay Chicago about devops culture.
AtoZ CSS: Widows (5m) oct 9
Paged media, Widows and Orphans.
Nested Attributes and fields_for (9m) oct 9
Forum Series Part 3 from gorails.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Food Fight 201410 (1h22) oct 7
Windows Automation for Frustrated Sysadmins.
Ruby5 501 (6m) oct 7
Rails data migrations, tools for optimization, Bundler::Updater, UUID with Postgres, Active Record, Ruby 2.2.0.
Ruby Rogues 177 (1h17) oct 8
Creativity and Technology.
Javascript Jabber 129 (54m) oct 8
BaaS with Ryan Done.
NodeUp 73 (1h04) oct 9
An internet of things show.
Adventure in angular #11 (34m) oct 10
Angular Fire with David East and Kato Wulf.
Web Platform #13 (1h07) oct 10
MeshBlu, NPM, and The Internet of Everywhere.

item.title: Green Ruby News #087
item.description:
As there is a lot of new subscribers this week, let me remind you what this newsletter is.
I'm a french fullstack geek living in Taiwan, ruby lover, and currently in a devops phase. I don't have much time to surf around during the week as I have a fulltime job. So every Sunday I dedicate 4 to 6 hours to sort my inbox, check stuff, track what's new, so I can remain current.
And then as I'm doing it for myself, well, I structured it a bit and sent my review to some friends. Mailchimp offers a free tier, the review is done already, why not share it to a wider audience. Xenor sends me some links every week, as well as various other people now. Having more people reading it and appreciating this review helps me to stay motivated doing it every week. So, thanks for that.
item.content:encoded:
#087 - oct 5th 2014

Edito

As there is a lot of new subscribers this week, let me remind you what this newsletter is.
I'm a french fullstack geek living in Taiwan, ruby lover, and currently in a devops phase. I don't have much time to surf around during the week as I have a fulltime job. So every Sunday I dedicate 4 to 6 hours to sort my inbox, check stuff, track what's new, so I can remain current.
And then as I'm doing it for myself, well, I structured it a bit and sent my review to some friends. Mailchimp offers a free tier, the review is done already, why not share it to a wider audience. Xenor sends me some links every week, as well as various other people now. Having more people reading it and appreciating this review helps me to stay motivated doing it every week. So, thanks for that.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
e3creative
Website of a digital agency.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Readme.io
Project documentation made easy.
Inline Manual
Interactive inline tutorials.
Sache
Discover Sass & Compass Extensions.
Xip.io
xip.io is a magic domain name that provides wildcard DNS for any IP address.
A Day in the Life of an Ember Developer
A free webinar with Yahuda Katz on October 16.
Enjoycss
Advanced online CSS3 generator.
Color code
Find your color scheme.
Freepik
Free Graphic Files for Download.
Taiga
Taiga is a project management platform for startups and agile developers (open source).
Internet Explorer Platform
The Internet Explorer team is looking for feature requests from the web developer community.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.2.0 beta2
Security fixes and some breaking changes (with beta1).
Spec me Maybe
Introduces the 'maybe' syntax to RSpec.
Inspeqtor
A go daemon to replace monit, by the author of sidekiq.
chef-koans
An experimental, test-driven way to learn about Chef.
Csstyle
Csstyle is a modern approach for crafting maintainable stylesheets.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
10 skills that will make you a better Rubyist sep 29
Skills required to advance your career (and get a better salary.
Adding a staging environment to Rails sep 29
A staging environment is a perfect place to battle test your code under the conditions of production.
How Do Gems Work? sep 29
Knowing RubyGems even at this surface level will help out a lot.
Benefits of Writing a DSL in Ruby sep 29
Creating a domain specific language to accelerate and streamline the development process.
How GitHub is using Web Components in production sep 29
Ssking some questions to Joshua Peek, a programmer at GitHub.
Responsive Images with srcset sep 30
If youâ€™re just changing resolutions, use srcset.
Hacker's Guide to Setting up Your Mac sep 30
Some techniques to apply automation to the setup of your Mac.
CDN acceptance testing oct 1
How gov.uk migrated to one CDN provider to another. Bonus, the source code of their tests.
Getting Started With Active Job oct 1
With the release of Rails 4.2, Active Job abstracts background workers syntax.
Taste and The Zen of GitHub oct 2
What taste means in Github growth.
Code Reviews at Harvest oct 2
Some good ideas about how to do the code review.
What is kubernetes and how to use it oct 2
Solution to scale your web services both vertically and horizontally.
Rails with Webpack - Why and How oct 2
An alternative for bundling your assets for some projects.
Refactoring Ruby with Monads oct 3
How monads can help to make code simpler, clearer and more reusable.
Better Know Enumerable: Partition oct 3
Using the partition to split a collection into two complementary parts.
AngularJS Tutorial: A Comprehensive 10,000 Word Guide oct 3
An ultimate resource point to begin learning AngularJS.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
AtoZ CSS: Vertical-align (5m) oct 1
The vertical-align property and how and when it works.
Gogaruco 2014 (13 videos) oct 3
Golden Gate Ruby Conference.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
DevOps cafe 55 (1h12) sep 30
With Tom Limoncelli.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 170 (1h11) oct 1
Salesforce $1 Million Hackathon @ Dreamforce 2014.
Ruby Rogues 176 (58m) oct 1
Rails as an SOA Client with Pete Hodgson.
Javascript Jabber 128 (55m) oct 1
Famo.us with Steve Newcomb.
The Ship Show 49 (1h04) oct 1
The Pulse of PuppetConf 2014.
CodePen #24 (31m) oct 2
Our Responsibilities at CodePen.
Adventure in angular #10 (34m) oct 2
Preferred Backends with Angular.
Ruby5 500 (6m) oct 3
Greenscreen.io, onboarding your junior devs, better Rubyist, staging environments, absolutes.
The Cloudcast #164 (28m) oct 3
Full-Stack Real-Time Monitoring from the Cloud. Datadog.

item.title: Green Ruby News #086
item.description: This is the week of ShellShock, as most of you already know, this is going to be a troubled time for old servers again (well, who still uses cgi scripts, right?). On a brighter side, I also went to rails pacific yesterday, it was nice to meet some Green Ruby subscribers there.
item.content:encoded:
#086 - sep 28th 2014

Edito

This is the week of ShellShock, as most of you already know, this is going to be a troubled time for old servers again (well, who still uses cgi scripts, right?). On a brighter side, I also went to rails pacific yesterday, it was nice to meet some Green Ruby subscribers there.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Guillaume Bouvet

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Regex 101
Yet another regexp online testing tool.
Ruby Science

Material Design

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
ScrLib
Polyglot code analysis library, built with hackability in mind.
Trailblazer

A distributed party with commands, events and projections.
Pact

TTY
The Ruby toolbox that you can use for building CLI projects.

When Chef is too heavy, use Bash Booster, using Bash only.

Getting an app deployed inside a Docker container..
Wrapping Your API In A Custom Ruby Gem sep 25
If you have an API, publishing a gem for using it makes sense.
Build a rails application without database sep 26
Occasionally, you may want to build a Rails app without ActiveRecord.
Prefer Objects as Method Parameters, Not Class Names sep 26
Some kind of class-oriented programming.
Why You Should be Excited About Hadoop 2.0 sep 26
Hadoop 2.0 is a whole new elephant.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Velocity Conference 2014 (30 videos) sep 21
Web performance and operations.
AtoZ CSS: Unicode-range (6m) sep 24
About font-face and unicode-range.
Gorails #25 (16m) sep 28
Forum Series Part 1: Architecture.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #117 (27m) sep 22
Designing Quality (Will Sulinski).
Ruby5 498 (7m) sep 23
Ruby 2.1.3, Goldiloader, Airborne, Eager Loading, Daemons, Swift for Rubyists.

Ruby5 499 (5m) sep 26
shell shock, hangar, rubytapas, from tails 3.2 to 4.3, burn.

item.title: Green Ruby News #085
item.description: There is some people every day on our irc channel, but as I wanted to try slack I opened a room there too (recent upgrades on hipchat were very annoying). Poke me if you want an invite to join it, for some chatting, or just if you want to see how slack works.
item.content:encoded:
#085 - sep 21th 2014

Edito

There is some people every day on our irc channel, but as I wanted to try slack I opened a room there too (recent upgrades on hipchat were very annoying). Poke me if you want an invite to join it, for some chatting, or just if you want to see how slack works.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.

Party mode

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.

Elixir finally reached a stable milestone.

A rails logger that don't let log entries for concurrent requests overlap.

A ruby web framework where your ruby runs on both server and client.

Communication is king. It has to be, otherwise it all falls apart.
Getting Started with CSS Shapes sep 16
Wrapping content around custom paths.
Postgres Window Functions sep 16

Everything About Rake Tasks sep 17

4 ways Docker fundamentally changes application development sep 17
How Docker containers streamline development and deployment.
9 ways to speed up your RSpec tests sep 19
Various tips to make your tests faster.
Splitting monolithic Rails applications sep 19

Also illustrates the use of the postgres window function.
Testing Page Objects with SitePrism sep 19

Listen

What could be heard last week ..

item.title: Green Ruby News #084
item.description: If you are not far from Denver in the US, you may need to know that this week there is the Denver Startup Week by Thoughtbot. I hope they will put some videos online.
item.content:encoded:
#084 - sep 14th 2014

Edito

If you are not far from Denver in the US, you may need to know that this week there is the Denver Startup Week by Thoughtbot. I hope they will put some videos online.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer

Listen

item.title: Green Ruby News #083
item.description: This week there is some progress on the future version of Green Ruby website, you can check https://github.com/greenruby/grn-js if you are curious. And if you want to contribute, you are welcome to join us (just send a mail to mose@greenruby.org). Thanks Quentin, Greg, Jared, Xenor and Pooyan that already jumped in.
item.content:encoded:
#083 - sep 7th 2014

Edito

This week there is some progress on the future version of Green Ruby website, you can check https://github.com/greenruby/grn-js if you are curious. And if you want to contribute, you are welcome to join us (just send a mail to mose@greenruby.org). Thanks Quentin, Greg, Jared, Xenor and Pooyan that already jumped in.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
The 100 Greatest Free Fonts for 2014
All kinds of typefaces which can be seamlessly integrated into any design.
Tab Styles Inspiration
A small collection of styles for tabs.
20 Useful Docs and Guides for Front-End Developers sep 5
A small collection of styles for tabs.
What are the best programming fonts?
Around 50 fonts reviewed.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Gridlover
The tool to establish a typographic system with modular scale and vertical rhythm.
Zerotier
Network Virtualization Everywhere.
Kobra
Collaborative code editor, plus video and voice.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Kitematic
The easiest way to start using Docker on your Mac (with a UI, even).
Impulse
Library for building dynamic physics based interactions, with a focus on mobile web.
Neo4j.rb 3.0.rc
Ruby driver for the Neo4j graph database.
Gravit
New and fresh thinking open source design tool (written in HTML5/js/css).
Consul 0.4
Solution for service discovery, configuration, and orchestration.
AMCSS
Use HTML attributes and their values rather than classes for styling elements.
Transcrypt
Transparently encrypt files within a git repository.
AngularStrap
AngularJS 1.2+ native directives for Bootstrap 3.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Rails Authorization sep 1
How to control access in a Rails application, with Pundit or others.
SOA and Rails - Overview sep 1
Review of all the ways to implement a scalable SOA architecture.
Git: The Safety Net for Your Projects sep 2
Various insights about git, and special attention to branches, reset vs revert, bisect.
SOA and Rails - using HTTP sep 2
Part 2 of this collection of great articles about SOA, this one focus on HTTP exchanges.
SOA and Rails - using AMQP sep 3
Part 3 of the articles about SOA, now checking the AMQP way.
Service objects in Rails sep 3
To design clean and maintainable code.
Back to Basics: SOLID sep 3
Five fundamental principles that help engineers write maintainable code.
Verifying Doubles in RSpec 3 sep 3
Create test doubles that verify themselves as conforming to the same interface as a 'real' object.
SOA and Rails - Introducing RackRabbit sep 4
Part 4 about SOA, with a custom MQ solution, alternative to bunny.
Different controllers for different contexts sep 4
Making your application easier to understand, maintain and grow.
Drop-in Responsive Styles With Sass sep 4
Clever usage of a +responsive mixin in SASS.
An Introduction to WebGL sep 5
From zero to a working 3D application, how the various concepts work and why.
How to design APIs that last sep 5
Initial design principles which help building long lived APIs.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
SysadminCasts #36 (4m) sep 1
CLI Monday: column and tr.
AtoZ CSS: Required (5m) sep 2
Using :required and other state-based pseudo classes.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #114 (25m) sep 1
Offer Value First (Ryan Delk).
CodePen 21 (36m) sep 2
Planning new features.
Web platform #9 (1h03) sep 3
Web Accessibility for JavaScript Components and Custom Elements.
Ruby Rogues 172 (1h16) sep 3
Extreme Deployment with Badri Janakiraman and Florian Motlik.
Javascript Jabber 124 (1h44) sep 3
The Origin of Javascript with Brendan Eich.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 166 (59m) sep 4
Tom & Nick Mango - Rails Rumble 2014 Preview.
Ruby5 493 (6m) sep 5
TimeWithZone, descriptive_statistics, ActiveJob and GlobalID, Paperdragon, English operators.
DevOps Cafe 54 (47m) sep 5
Gene Kim, DevOps in the Enterprise.
The Cloudcast #160 (46m) sep 5
The State of The Cloudcast - MidYear 2014.
Node Up 71 (1h19) sep 5
a team netflix show.

item.title: Green Ruby News #082
item.description: There was some much publications this week, it is harder and harder to make a selection. Also, I begin to have too long a list of podcasts and sometimes I can't listen to them all. Should I focus more? It would be annoying as I like eclecticism, in a certain range. Anyways, I'm happy to announce we almost have 500 subscribers by now, and more and more traffic on the website. You may laugh, but as I don't like google and their analytics/tracking, I use the good old webalizer for the Greenruby site stats. So vintage! Maybe one day I will setup a piwik though.
item.content:encoded:
#082 - aug 31th 2014

Edito

There was some much publications this week, it is harder and harder to make a selection. Also, I begin to have too long a list of podcasts and sometimes I can't listen to them all. Should I focus more? It would be annoying as I like eclecticism, in a certain range. Anyways, I'm happy to announce we almost have 500 subscribers by now, and more and more traffic on the website. You may laugh, but as I don't like google and their analytics/tracking, I use the good old webalizer for the Greenruby site stats. So vintage! Maybe one day I will setup a piwik though.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Wired UK
Great design with horizontal scrolling.
Freelancers websites
Awwwards published a review of 6 websites for freelance designers this week.
Top 10 CodePens of the Week
Great selection if visual effects for your web UIs.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ops School Curriculum
Comprehensive program to become an operations engineer, community written.
Project GITenberg
43,000 book in this git-powered version of project Gutenberg.
Fearless Rails Deployment
(book) deploy your Rails applications using Chef, RVM, Nginx, Unicorn, and Vagrant.
Learn ruby on rails

Jobmote

Logio
Real-time log monitoring in your browser (with node.js + socket.io).
curl.io
Share your files from your Terminal.
Rocketboard
Capture whiteboards.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Git 2.1 Released
The list of new features and improvements is large.
Web console
Rails Console on the Browser.
Descriptive Statistics
This gem adds methods to the Enumerable module to allow easy calculation of basic descriptive statistics.
PutsReq
Record the HTTP requests sent or received.
Timesheet.js
JavaScript library for simple HTML5 & CSS3 time sheets.
Chartist
Simple responsive charts library.
Slap
Sublime-like terminal-based text editor.
Vedeu
Terminal based application framework in ruby without the need for Ncurses.
vagrant-env
Lets you place environment variables in a .env which are available to the Vagrantfile via ENV.
Stellar
Fast database snapshot and restore tool for development.
Gogs
A self-hosted Git service written in Go.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Digging Rails - How Rails Initializes Itself aug 24
Detailed look at the Rails (4.2) initialization process.
The Lesser-known Features in Rails 4.2 aug 25
Some less advertised features that will totally improve your daily work with Rails.
Checklist for Deploying a Rails App to Heroku aug 26
Optimal production deploy to Heroku.
Docker Do's And Don'ts aug 26
Lessons learnt from building a SaaS with Docker from devo.ps.
Reading Rails - TimeWithZone aug 27
Where TimeWithZone comes from, and how it works (in rails).
Ruby version usage in commercial projects, 2014 edition aug 27
Like last year, Semaphore published the stats of the projects they run tests for.
Faster capistrano deploys aug 27
Deploy times from 5 minutes to less than 15 seconds.
Paperdragon: Explicit Image Processing aug 28
Image processing gem for control freaks.
Terraform 0.2 aug 28
Terraform is a tool for safely and efficiently building, combining, and launching infrastructure
Yahoo stops YUI development aug 29
After 8 years of service, YUI slips into darkness.
This is why you never end up hiring good developers aug 30
Great insight about technical recruitment.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
AtoZ CSS: Quotes (5m) aug 26
The difference between dumb quotes and smart quotes.
How to use Rubyâ€™s English and/or operators without going nuts (5m) aug 26
A ruby tapas episode newly liberated by Avdi.
Rails 4.2 Introduction (6m) aug 27
A quick look at the new features of Rails 4.2 in the first beta that was recently released.
Interview with Sandstorms founder about the personal cloud platform (27m) aug 27
Why NOT use Docker in Sandstorm?

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #113 (33m) aug 25
Minimum Path to Awesome (Rob Walling).
CodePen 20 (35m) aug 25
Talking about APIs.
Web platform #8 (32m) aug 26
Exploring Dart & Polymer.
The Changelog 128 (1h) aug 27
Lineman.js and JavaScript apps with Justin Searls.
DevOps Cafe 53 (1h04) aug 27
Mandi Walls through her journeys in the DevOps movement.
Ruby Rogues 171 (1h06) aug 27
Evaluating Yourself.
Javascript Jabber 123 (43m) aug 27
Traceur with Erik Arvidsson.
Food Fight Show 78 (1h15) aug 27
ChefDK
Ruby5 492 (7m) aug 27
Rails 4.2beta, Royce, JSON API Resources, Country Select 2.0, Harpoon, Poodr course, feature focus.
Arrested Devops 19 (1h05) aug 28
Started as a Dev, now doing Ops.
Ops All The Things 010 (50m) aug 29
Development and the SysAdmin.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 165 (1h05) aug 29
James Chevalier - citystrides.com.

item.title: Green Ruby News #081
item.description: Hmm I really don't like my icons. I added categories from time to time and got some random icon to match them. Now I look at the result and I don't like it. Maybe someone can suggest a collection that could match the Green Ruby categories collection? For example the ops and tool categories are too identical. and I need a generic engineering category too. It would be so lovely to have a uniform look for our icons. Maybe some monochrome Heroku style kind of 16 pixel icons. So, if you feel you can help, contact me at mose@greenruby.org.
item.content:encoded:
#081 - aug 24th 2014

Edito

Hmm I really don't like my icons. I added categories from time to time and got some random icon to match them. Now I look at the result and I don't like it. Maybe someone can suggest a collection that could match the Green Ruby categories collection? For example the ops and tool categories are too identical. and I need a generic engineering category too. It would be so lovely to have a uniform look for our icons. Maybe some monochrome Heroku style kind of 16 pixel icons. So, if you feel you can help, contact me at mose@greenruby.org.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Bubble
Digital agency original website.
Beautiful Open
A gallery to prove that Open Source Project can have beautiful websites.
Pixel Perfect Precision Handbook

Use

Biting the Bullet and Actually Learning JavaScript

The Complete iOS 7 Course

Recroom

noVNC

Epic privacy browser
What you browse & search should always be private.
perf-tools
Performance analysis tools based on Linux perf_events (aka perf) and ftrace.
Duo.js
New package manager that blends the best ideas from Component, Browserify and Go.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
A Way to Organize POROs in Rails aug 15

Use .pluck If You Only Need a Subset of Model Attributes aug 20
Pull back only the attributes you need as an array.
I Spent 3 Days With Sandi Metz â€“ Hereâ€™s What I Learned aug 20
Full report about 3 full days of pair programming, code reviews and spirited group discussions.
20 Free jQuery Plugins for Enhancing Web-based User Interfaces aug 20
Open source examples of new jQuery plugins which can be used to enhance any website layout.
Modern Web Best Practice: Pub/Sub aug 20
Advantages of Pub/Sub libraries to communicate between modules.
Software Craftsmen Are Arrogant, Slow, and Dogmatic aug 21
Don't fall for the provocative title, this is a debunking exercise.
Power Up Your Team with Nonviolent Communication Principles aug 21
No matter what, the fate of every company depends on the teamâ€™s ability to communicate clearly and constructively.
Regular Expressions Tools & Resources aug 22
15 websites for improving your Regex power.
What Docker does right and what it doesn't do right yet aug 22
Docker founder Solomon Hykes explained at LinuxCon what Docker is, what it does right, and what it still needs to work on.
Orchestrating docker containers in production using fig aug 22
How to define and run a multi-container app.
Sass 3.4 is out aug 22
Code name 'Selective Steve'. Here are the details.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...

The five different pseudo elements.
Cascadia Ruby Conf 2014 (17 videos) aug 19
Dive into routing more deeply than just basic resources and writing routes from scratch.
Build podcast 62: Docker (28m) aug 22
create isolated environment for apps based on docker.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..

The Epistemology of DevOps.

Data By Design (Joanne Cheng).
DevOps Cafe 52 (1h) aug 18

item.title: Green Ruby News #080
item.description: Btw did you know I keep a collection of subreddit to watch ? It's on http://www.reddit.com/user/ozmose/m/greenruby.
item.content:encoded:

  mose - the green ruby editor
